hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and 5-day Bollinger Band width contracts to <0.5 of its 30-day average, a downside breakout below the lower Bollinger Band (20-day, 2σ) will initiate a transition to BEAR regime with 70% probability within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes with compressed volatility often precede directional moves. Downside breakouts from compression in neutral environments tend to sustain as institutional selling accelerates and retail sentiment turns negative, creating self-reinforcing bearish momentum.
entry_conditions: BTC 5-day Bollinger Band width < 0.5 * 30-day average width
BTC price closes below lower Bollinger Band (20-day, 2σ)
Volume on breakout day > 1.5 * 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to BEAR (confidence > 70%) OR 8% price decline from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims and closes above lower Bollinger Band + 2% buffer

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of signals fail to transition to BEAR within 5 days OR average loss on stopped trades exceeds 3.5%
